property.name: pxf.service.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal pxf service should use. _HOST is replaced automatically with hostnames FQDN

property.name: pxf.service.kerberos.keytab
property.description: Kerberos path to keytab file owned by pxf service with permissions 0400

property.name: pxf.service.user.impersonation
property.description: End-user identity impersonation, set to true to enable, false to disable

property.name: pxf.service.kerberos.constrained-delegation
property.description: Makes user impersonation work via Kerberos constrained delegation based on S4U2Self/Proxy Kerberos extension. This method does not require the PXF principal to be a Hadoop proxy user, but requires the S4U2 feature to be enabled in an Active Directory / IPA Server. Additional configuration is needed in the Active Directory / IPA Server to enable the PXF principal to impersonate end users. Set to true to enable, false to disable.

property.name: pxf.service.kerberos.ticket-renew-window
property.description: By default, PXF refreshes the Kerberos ticket when 80% (0.8) of its lifespan has elapsed. Specifies the window, as a float, at which PXF will actively refresh the ticket. This value must be between 0 and 1. Setting this value to 0 means that every PXF request will get a new ticket.

property.name: pxf.ppd.hive
property.description: Specifies whether Predicate Pushdown feature is enabled for Hive profiles.

property.name: pxf.sasl.connection.retries
property.description: Specifies the number of retries to perform when a SASL connection is refused by a Namenode due to 'GSS initiate failed' error.

property.name: pxf.orc.write.decimal.overflow
property.description: Specifies behavior of the PXF ORC profiles when writing NUMERIC data that exceeds the maximum precision of 38. Valid values are error, round and ignore. The default value is round. If set to error, PXF will report an error, potentially leaving an incomplete dataset in the external system. If set to round, PXF will try to round the value to meet both precision and scale requirements, or report an error if the value cannot be rounded, potentially leaving an incomplete dataset in the external system. If set to ignore, PXF will try to round the value to meet only the precision requirement; otherwise PXF will write NULL instead of the value (as in previous PXF versions).

property.name: pxf.orc.write.timezone.utc
property.description: Specifies whether the PXF ORC writer should use UTC timezone when writing timestamp values. If set to false, the PXF ORC writer will use the local timezone of the PXF JVM instead.

property.name: pxf.parquet.write.decimal.overflow
property.description: Specifies behavior of the PXF Parquet profiles when writing NUMERIC data that exceeds the maximum precision of 38. Valid values are error, round, and ignore. The default value is round. If set to error, PXF will report an error, potentially leaving an incomplete dataset in the external system. If set to round, PXF will try to round the value to meet both precision and scale requirements, or report an error if the value cannot be rounded, potentially leaving an incomplete dataset in the external system. If set to ignore, PXF will try to round the value to meet both precision and scale requirements; otherwise PXF will write NULL if the value cannot be rounded (as in previous PXF versions).

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.int64.timestamps
property.description: If the parameter is set to false, timestamps will be written to Parquet as INT96. If the parameter is set to true, both TIMESTAMP and TIMESTAMPZ values will be written as INT64 with TimestampLogicalTypeAnnotation. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_INT64_TIMESTAMPS parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is false.

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.local.pxf.timezone.write
property.description: If the parameter is set to true, the TIMESTAMP value will be converted to UTC based on the local time zone of the JVM running the PXF service. For example, if the local JVM time zone is +03:00, and a timestamp 2005-10-03 15:05:15.123 is received from Greenplum, it will be converted to UTC as 2005-10-03 12:05:15.123 (- 3 hours). This converted value will then be written to the Parquet file. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_LOCAL_PXF_TIMEZONE_WRITE parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is true.

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.local.pxf.timezone.read
property.description: If the parameter is set to true, the TIMESTAMP value from the Parquet file will be converted to the local time zone of the JVM running the PXF service, and then sent to Greenplum. For example, if the local time zone of the JVM is +03:00 and the Parquet file contains the timestamp 2005-10-03 12:00:00.000, it will be converted to 2005-10-03 15:00:00.000 (+3 hours) before being sent to Greenplum. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_LOCAL_PXF_TIMEZONE_READ parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is true.

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.logical.type.interval
property.description: If the parameter is set to false, INTERVAL data type will be written to Parquet as FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY. If the parameter is set to true, INTERVAL data type will be written to Parquet as FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY with IntervalLogicalTypeAnnotation. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_LOGICAL_TYPE_INTERVAL parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is false.

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.logical.type.time
property.description: If the parameter is set to false, TIME data type will be written to Parquet as INT64. If the parameter is set to true, TIME data type will be written to Parquet as INT64 with TimeLogicalTypeAnnotation. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_LOGICAL_TYPE_TIME parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is false.

property.name: pxf.parquet.use.logical.type.uuid
property.description: If the parameter is set to false, UUID data type will be written to Parquet as FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY. If the parameter is set to true, UUID data type will be written to Parquet as FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY with UUIDLogicalTypeAnnotation. This parameter is equivalent to the USE_LOGICAL_TYPE_UUID parameter, which is used when creating external tables. If the parameter is specified in both places, the external table setting has higher priority. Default value is false.
